title: core(movement): stepwise MovementConfig; integrate into hauling (Fixes #230)
body:
## Summary
- Add `MovementConfig { stepwise: bool }` resource to control teleport vs stepwise movement
- Integrate into hauling execution to move carriers one tile per tick when enabled
- Default-enable in bootstrap for demos to avoid teleport artifacts

## Rationale
Issue #230 reported that job execution teleports agents/items. Stepwise movement makes simulation visually coherent and sets foundation for path integration.

## Compatibility
- Tests expect immediate behavior; default stepwise=false when `MovementConfig` is absent to preserve existing expectations
- Bootstrap opts-in for demos (`MovementConfig::default()`)

## Validation
- `./dev.sh validate` green: fmt, clippy, build (debug/release), doc tests, unit tests, demo validation

Fixes #230

title: core(schedule): process ItemSpawnQueue after mining (Fixes #229)
body:
## Summary
- Fix Jobs demo regression where mining produced no stone items
- Add `jobs::process_item_spawn_queue_system` to default schedule after mining
- Ensures item spawns are materialized before `auto_haul` creates haul jobs

## Details
Mining enqueues `ItemSpawnRequest` but the default schedule never processed the queue, so items never appeared in-world. By inserting the queue processing system immediately after `mine_job_execution_system`, stone items appear in the same tick and auto-haul can generate haul jobs for them.

## Validation
- Ran `./dev.sh validate` locally: format, clippy, build, tests (unit+doc), and demo validation all green
- Verified Jobs demo now shows 1 stone at mined tile and haul jobs are created

## Notes
- This decouples item creation from execution timing and reduces ordering footguns
- No behavior change for other systems; strictly corrects missing queue processing

Fixes #229

title: Implement M3 Recipe Registry Core Types with Validation and ECS Integration
body:
This PR implements the foundational recipe registry system for the workshops and production chains feature (Epic #32). It provides a complete data-first recipe model with validation, JSON loading, and ECS integration.

## Core Implementation

**New Types Added:**
- `IngredientSpec` - Defines required items and quantities for recipes
- `ProductSpec` - Defines output items, quantities, and byproduct status  
- `Recipe` - Complete recipe definition with inputs, outputs, stations, and work time
- `RecipeRegistry` - Central registry with validation and query capabilities

**Key Features:**
- Comprehensive validation that rejects invalid recipes (zero counts, missing fields, duplicate IDs)
- JSON parsing with detailed error handling and custom error types
- Embedded resource file via `include_str!()` for default recipes
- ECS Resource integration through `bootstrap.rs` for runtime access
- Station-based recipe filtering for workshop compatibility
- Support for multiple station types per recipe

## Extended Item System

Extended the `ItemType` enum to support the new crafting items:
```rust
pub enum ItemType {
    Stone,  // Existing
    Log,    // New - raw wood material
    Plank,  // New - processed wood
    Block,  // New - processed stone
}
```

Updated the job spawn system to handle all item types correctly.

## Example Recipes

The system ships with two example recipes as specified:

```json
{
  "recipes": [
    {
      "id": "logs_to_planks",
      "stations": ["carpenter"],
      "inputs": [{ "item": "Log", "count": 1 }],
      "outputs": [{ "item": "Plank", "count": 4 }],
      "work_time_ticks": 50
    },
    {
      "id": "stone_to_blocks", 
      "stations": ["mason"],
      "inputs": [{ "item": "Stone", "count": 1 }],
      "outputs": [{ "item": "Block", "count": 1 }],
      "work_time_ticks": 50
    }
  ]
}
```

## Testing Coverage

**Unit Tests (12 tests):**
- Recipe creation and validation
- JSON parsing with error handling  
- Registry operations and queries
- Station filtering functionality
- Default registry loading

**Integration Tests (5 tests):**
- ECS world integration via bootstrap
- Resource availability during runtime
- Cross-system compatibility validation

All existing tests continue to pass (65 tests total), ensuring no regressions.

## Usage

The registry is automatically loaded during world creation and available as an ECS Resource:

```rust
let world = build_standard_world(50, 50, 42, WorldOptions::default());
let registry = world.resource::<RecipeRegistry>();

// Query recipes by station type
let carpenter_recipes: Vec<_> = registry.recipes_for_station("carpenter").collect();

// Get specific recipe
let recipe = registry.get_recipe("logs_to_planks").unwrap();
```

This foundation enables future workshop system implementation while providing robust validation and extensibility for additional recipes and crafting mechanics.

Fixes #82.

title: save-load: persist RNG seed and tick metadata (Fixes #155)
body:
Adds tick_ms, ticks, and master_seed to SaveGame and restores Time and DeterministicRng on load. Keeps behavior deterministic across sessions.

- Core: SaveGame fields + load_world restore
- Tests: basic assertion on time metadata present

Labels: enhancement, area:save-load, size:M

title: save-load: deterministic entity ordering utilities + tests (Fixes #153)
body:
Centralizes deterministic entity sorting for saves and adds a regression test. Ordering key: (name, pos, vel, item_type, carriable). Minimal coupling; sort lives in save module.

- Core: sort_entities_deterministically() used by save_world
- Tests: verifies JSON equality regardless of spawn order
- Refactor: adds Ord on ItemType for stable comparisons

Labels: enhancement, area:save-load, size:M

title: save-load: add CBOR codec and --codec cbor (Fixes #158)
body:
Adds CBOR encode/decode helpers in core and wires --codec cbor to the save-load CLI demo.

- Core: encode_cbor/decode_cbor via ciborium
- CLI: --codec now supports json|ron|cbor (default json)
- Lockfile updated

Determinism preserved; logical schema unchanged.

Depends on #180 (RON) — please merge #180 first, then this.

Labels: enhancement, area:save-load, size:M

Fixes #158

title: save-load: add RON codec and --codec flag (Fixes #151)
body:
Implements RON codec helpers in core and wires a --codec flag in gc_cli save-load demo.

- Core: add encode_ron/decode_ron (format-agnostic helpers)
- CLI: global --codec json|ron with default json; validates roundtrip
- Lockfile updated for ron dependency

Determinism unchanged; logical schema preserved.

Labels: enhancement, area:save-load, size:M

Fixes #151

title: feat: implement core combat MVP components for issue #128
body:
## 📋 Overview

This PR implements the foundational ECS components for the Combat MVP system as specified in issue #128. It provides the basic building blocks needed for combat mechanics in the Goblin Camp colony management game.

## 🎯 Changes Made

### ⚔️ Core Combat Components
- **Faction & FactionKind**: Defines entity allegiance (Goblins, Invaders, Neutral) with hostility rules
- **Health**: Tracks HP with damage/healing methods, clamping, and life/death checks
- **CombatStats**: Combat capabilities (accuracy, evasion, attack, defense, damage range)
- **AttackCooldown**: Timing system to prevent rapid attacks
- **Combatant**: Marker component for entities that can participate in combat
- **Dead**: Marker component for deceased entities
- **Target**: Lightweight targeting component for combat systems

### 🔧 Technical Features
- **Save/Load Support**: All components derive Serialize/Deserialize for persistence
- **Deterministic Simulation**: Integer-only math for consistent results
- **Comprehensive Validation**: Proper validation and clamping in constructors
- **Helper Methods**: Common operations (damage, healing, hit chance calculations)
- **Full Test Coverage**: Unit tests for all components and methods

## 📋 Issue Links
- **Issue**: #128 (Combat MVP core components)

## 🏷️ Labels
- `enhancement` - New feature implementation
- `area:combat` - Combat system development
- `size:M` - Medium-sized feature (0.5-1d)

## ✅ Acceptance Criteria Met
- ✅ Components and enums added under gc_core with module docs
- ✅ serde derives compile (behind existing feature flags)
- ✅ Unit tests cover Health clamps, invariants, and constructors
- ✅ Round-trip serde for each component (except Target due to Entity limitations)
- ✅ No public API breaks in existing modules

## 🔧 Quality Assurance
- All copilot review feedback addressed:
  - Added validation for negative max_hp in Health constructors
  - Fixed Health::full() to use Self::new() for consistent validation
  - Added Serialize/Deserialize derives to Combatant and Dead marker components
  - Comprehensive validation prevents panics and invalid states

## 🎯 Impact
This provides the foundation for follow-up combat systems including targeting, movement, attack resolution, and death handling. The components are designed for deterministic simulation and full save/load compatibility.
